SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.actor.plane.component

Class HeartDisplay

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.actor.plane.component.HeartDisplay
public class HeartDisplay extends Object
The HeartDisplay class represents a graphical component that displays a player's hearts in a game. It uses an HBox container to arrange the hearts and the player's plane icon. The number of hearts displayed can be dynamically updated.

This class provides methods to initialize the heart display, set the number of hearts, and retrieve the container for the heart display.

Note: This class relies on ImageManager for retrieving image names and images.

See Also:

      public HeartDisplay(int playerIndex, double xPosition, double yPosition, int initialHearts)
      Constructs a HeartDisplay instance with specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - The index of the player.
      xPosition - The x-coordinate of the heart display.
      yPosition - The y-coordinate of the heart display.
      initialHearts - The initial number of hearts to display.

      public String getImageName(int playerIndex)
      Returns the image name corresponding to the given player index.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player (0 or 1)
      Returns:
      the image name for the player if the index is 0 or 1, otherwise null
